Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where it wants to - "waiting my turn" -, while the Dutch continue wandering about until they bump into something. How very different cultures!

In terms of net result however, both are perfectly valid approaches.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater and watching it. With movies you can watch in your house,I fall asleep all the time.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me Strawberry Fields Forever and A Day in the Life by The Beatles.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics of other films such as The Last Dragon, Karate Kid and Mad Max. Despite it's obvious rip-offs there is a certain charm about "American Ninja".
